body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If this may be security issue, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:

I run

```
kubectl describe pod nonexistent-pod
```

and I got

```
error: another mapper was already selected, cannot use unstructured types
```

Running with `--v=9` shows

```
$ kubectl --v=9 describe pod nonexistent-pod
I0502 10:51:46.138889    6775 loader.go:359] Config loaded from file /var/run/kubernetes/admin.kubeconfig
I0502 10:51:46.142979    6775 round_trippers.go:386] curl -k -v -XGET  -H "Accept: application/json" -H "User-Agent: kubectl/v1.11.0 (linux/amd64) kubernetes/ed9b25c" 'https://localhost:6443/api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/nonexistent-pod'
I0502 10:51:46.151237    6775 round_trippers.go:405] GET https://localhost:6443/api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/nonexistent-pod 404 Not Found in 8 milliseconds
I0502 10:51:46.151287    6775 round_trippers.go:411] Response Headers:
I0502 10:51:46.151291    6775 round_trippers.go:414]     Content-Length: 198
I0502 10:51:46.151295    6775 round_trippers.go:414]     Date: Wed, 02 May 2018 10:51:46 GMT
I0502 10:51:46.151317    6775 round_trippers.go:414]     Content-Type: application/json
I0502 10:51:46.151361    6775 request.go:897] Response Body: {"kind":"Status","apiVersion":"v1","metadata":{},"status":"Failure","message":"pods \"nonexistent-pod\" not found","reason":"NotFound","details":{"name":"nonexistent-pod","kind":"pods"},"code":404}
F0502 10:51:46.152582    6775 helpers.go:113] error: another mapper was already selected, cannot use unstructured types
```

**What you expected to happen**:

```
Error from server (NotFound): pods "nonexistent-pod" not found
```

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

With Kubernetes master branch
```
PATH=/home/test/kubernetes/third_party/etcd:${PATH} ./hack/local-up-cluster.sh
```

and in different terminal on the same machine

```
kubectl describe pod nonexistent-pod
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
$ kubectl version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.0-alpha.1.487+ed9b25c90241b2", GitCommit:"ed9b25c90241b2b8a1fa10b96381c57f99ca952a", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-05-02T11:15:24Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.0-alpha.1.487+ed9b25c90241b2", GitCommit:"ed9b25c90241b2b8a1fa10b96381c57f99ca952a", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-05-02T11:15:24Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.1", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration: VM via libvirtd
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Fedora 27 with golang-1.10.1-1.fc29.x86_64 from rawhide
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux kubernetes.example.test 4.15.17-300.fc27.x86_64 #1 SMP Thu Apr 12 18:19:17 UTC 2018 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools: ??
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: kubectl describe on nonexistent pod results in error: another mapper was already selected, cannot use unstructured types
